## Standard Filtrations and Modifications of Martingales

Throughout, $(\Omega,\mathcal{A},\mathop{{}\mathbb{P}})$ is the probability space in the background, the time-set is $\mathbb{R}_{+}$ unless specified otherwise.

### Augmentation

::: {.definition  name=""}


Filtration $\mathbb{F}$ is said to be augmented if $(\Omega,\mathcal{A},\mathop{{}\mathbb{P}})$ is complete and all negligible events in $\mathcal{F_0}$.

:::

Suppose that $(\Omega,\mathcal{A},\mathop{{}\mathbb{P}})$ is complete and $\mathbb{F}$ be arbitrary filtration. Let $\mathcal{N}$ be collection of all null sets and
$$
\bar{\mathcal{F}}_{t}=\sigma(\mathcal{F}_{t}\cup \mathcal{N})
$$
then $\bar{\mathbb{F}}$ is **augmentation** of $\mathbb{F}$, $\mathbb{F}$ is augmented iff $\mathbb{F}=\bar{\mathbb{F}}$.
